Source code for dataviz_elyes_donia.relationship_graph

import streamlit as st
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import networkx as nx
from dataviz_elyes_donia.data_pipeline import load_data



[docs]
def display_relationship_graph(file):
    """
    Affiche le graphe des relations entre les variables d'un DataFrame.

    Args:
        file: Fichier de donn√©es t√©l√©charg√© par l'utilisateur.
    """
    st.title("üîó Graphe des Relations de Donn√©es")

    # Chargement des donn√©es
    df = load_data(file)
    if df is None:
        return

    st.subheader("üìä Matrice de Corr√©lation")
    numeric_cols = df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns

    if len(numeric_cols) < 2:
        st.warning("‚ö†Ô∏è Il faut au moins deux variables num√©riques pour g√©n√©rer un graphe de relations.")
        return

    # Calcul de la matrice de corr√©lation
    corr_matrix = df[numeric_cols].corr()
    st.dataframe(corr_matrix)

    # Seuil de filtrage des corr√©lations faibles
    threshold = st.slider("üîç Seuil de corr√©lation minimale", 0.0, 1.0, 0.5)

    # Cr√©ation du graphe des relations
    G = nx.Graph()

    # Ajouter des n≈ìuds pour chaque variable num√©rique
    for col in numeric_cols:
        G.add_node(col)

    # Ajouter des ar√™tes pour les corr√©lations fortes
    for i in range(len(numeric_cols)):
        for j in range(i + 1, len(numeric_cols)):
            corr_value = corr_matrix.iloc[i, j]
            if abs(corr_value) >= threshold:
                G.add_edge(numeric_cols[i], numeric_cols[j], weight=corr_value)

    # Visualisation du graphe avec Plotly
    pos = nx.spring_layout(G)
    edge_x = []
    edge_y = []
    edge_weights = []

    for edge in G.edges(data=True):
        x0, y0 = pos[edge[0]]
        x1, y1 = pos[edge[1]]
        edge_x += [x0, x1, None]
        edge_y += [y0, y1, None]
        edge_weights.append(edge[2]['weight'])

    edge_trace = go.Scatter(
        x=edge_x,
        y=edge_y,
        line=dict(width=2, color='#888'),
        hoverinfo='none',
        mode='lines'
    )

    node_x = []
    node_y = []
    node_text = []

    for node in G.nodes():
        x, y = pos[node]
        node_x.append(x)
        node_y.append(y)
        node_text.append(node)

    node_trace = go.Scatter(
        x=node_x,
        y=node_y,
        mode='markers+text',
        text=node_text,
        textposition='bottom center',
        hoverinfo='text',
        marker=dict(
            showscale=True,
            colorscale='YlGnBu',
            size=20,
            color=[len(list(G.neighbors(node))) for node in G.nodes()],
            colorbar=dict(
                thickness=15,
                title='Nombre de Connexions',
                xanchor='left',
                titleside='right'
            ),
            line_width=2
        )
    )

    fig = go.Figure(data=[edge_trace, node_trace],
                    layout=go.Layout(
                        title='Graphique des Relations de Corr√©lation',
                        titlefont_size=16,
                        showlegend=False,
                        hovermode='closest',
                        margin=dict(b=20,l=5,r=5,t=40),
                        annotations=[dict(
                            text="Corr√©lations des Variables",
                            showarrow=False,
                            xref="paper", yref="paper",
                            x=0.005, y=-0.002 )],
                        xaxis=dict(showgrid=False, zeroline=False, showticklabels=False),
                        yaxis=dict(showgrid=False, zeroline=False, showticklabels=False)
                    ))

    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
